measures.name: zedgk_12_electric_equipment
measures.description: This measure removes all existing electric equipment from spaces recognized as primary or secondary school space types. One exception is that loads assigned directly to a space where the load definition contains "Elev" or "elev" will be left alone. New electric equipment will be added based on the K12 ZEDG recommendations. Kitchen equipment won't be altered by this measure. There is a stand alone ZEDG measure specifically for the kitchen.
measures.modeler_description: Equipment in un-recognized spaces will be left alone. This measure will attempt to retain schedules from the initial model. If the initial model contained multiple electric equipment objects associated with multiple schedules, then one of those schedules will be picked for the new electric equipment.

arguments.option_1: Option 1 Description: Customized values for ZEDG - This measure removes all existing electric equipment from spaces recognized as primary or secondary school space types. One exception is that loads assigned directly to a space whre the load definition contains "Elev" or "elev" will be left alone. New electric equipment will be added based on the 50% K12 AEDG recommendations. Kitchen equipment wont' be altered by this measure. There is a stand alone AEDG measure specifically for the kitchen.

arguments.name: material_cost_ip
arguments.display_name: Material and Installation Costs for Electric Equipment per Floor Area ($/ft^2).

options.name: ZEDG Elec Equip
options.description: Option 1 Description: Customized values for ZEDG - This measure removes all existing electric equipment from spaces recognized as primary or secondary school space types. One exception is that loads assigned directly to a space whre the load definition contains "Elev" or "elev" will be left alone. New electric equipment will be added based on the 50% K12 AEDG recommendations. Kitchen equipment wont' be altered by this measure. There is a stand alone AEDG measure specifically for the kitchen.

measures.name: aedg_k_12_electric_equipment_controls
measures.description: This measure reduces the values associated with electric equipment schedules to simulate reductions due to equipment controls throughout the building. This includes occupancy based outlets or adapters, as well as network or timer based controls. Kitchen equipment controls are not altered by this measure. The kitchen has a dedicated measure of its own which includes equipment controls.
measures.modeler_description: This measure is intended to be used on schedules that have not previously been adjusted for advanced controls. If you run this measure multiple times you will end up with more schedule reduction than is appropriate. The schedules used in the OpenStudio templates have not been adjusted for advanced controls, so it is appropriate to run them through this measure to simulation their impact on energy use. This measure applies a reduction of 0.15 to schedule values that are below 0.5 start with, no reduction is applied to values that are at or above 0.5 to start with. As a result the lower the initial fractional value the higher the percentage reduction it will receive. Values won't be lowered to a value below 0.1. Values already below this level will keep their original value.

arguments.name: costTotal
arguments.display_name: Total cost for all Equipment Controls in the Building ($).

inputs.display_name: Total cost for all Equipment Controls in the Building ($).
inputs.name: costTotal

options.name: AEDG Elec Equip Controls
options.description: Option 1 Description

measures.name: zedgk_12_exterior_wall_construction
measures.description: This measure will modify existing exterior wall insulation levels based on construction type and climate zone. The climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. For steel and wood framed walls, insulation will be added to the exterior of the construction.
measures.modeler_description: Insulation recomendations are based on steel framed exterior walls.

arguments.option_1: Option 1 Description: ZEDG version, currently only set for steel frame walls. This measure will modify existing exterior wall insulation levels based on construction type and climate zone. The exterior wall construction type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. For mass and metal walls if an existing insulation layer can be found it will be increased, if not a new insulation layer will be added. For mass this will be at the exterior of the construction. For metal it will be added just behind the exterior layer. For steel and wood framed walls, insulation will be added to the exterior of the construction.

arguments.name: material_cost_insulation_increase_ip
arguments.display_name: Increase Cost per Area of Construction Where Insulation was Improved ($/ft^2).

options.name: ZEDG Ext Wall
options.description: Option 1 Description: ZEDG version, currently only set for steel frame walls. This measure will modify existing exterior wall insulation levels based on construction type and climate zone. The exterior wall construction type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. For mass and metal walls if an existing insulation layer can be found it will be increased, if not a new insulation layer will be added. For mass this will be at the exterior of the construction. For metal it will be added just behind the exterior layer. For steel and wood framed walls, insulation will be added to the exterior of the construction.

measures.name: zedgk_12_roof_construction
measures.description: ZEDG version, only setup for IEAD roof. This measure will modify existing roof insulation levels and Solar Reflective Index (SRI) values based on roof type and climate zone. The roof type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. If your model uses an attic, all attic surfaces should have an "Attic' intended surface type. For attics it doesn't matter what you put for "Standards Construction Type". The measure will check attic insulation where the attic is adjacent to other not attic spaces.

Relevant construction types are identified below. 




- Insulation entirely above deck (IEAD)




- Attic

For attics it doesn't matter what you put for "Standards Construction Type". The measure will check attic insulation where the attic is adjacent to other not attic spaces.

measures.name: aedg_k_12_interior_finishes
measures.description: This measure will adjust the visible reflectance of materials used on interior building surfaces. Different target values will be set for floors, ceilings, and furniture/interior partition surfaces.
measures.modeler_description: While the AEDG guide recommends unique wall reflectance targets above and below 7', the measure will use the 7' target on all interior walls. Cost was not included as part of this measure as there likely isn't a significant cost impact to lighter finishes. This measure will treat interior partition surfaces as furniture. The measure will only enhance reflectance. If a material already exceeds the target it will be left alone.

measures.name: zedgk_12_fenestration_and_daylighting_controls
measures.display_name: ZEDG K12 - Fenestration and Daylighting Controls
measures.description: This measure will remove all existing exterior windows, glass doors, and skylights from your model. They will be replaced with view and daylight windows as recommended by the Net Zero K12 recommendations. Windows on the south facade will have a exterior shading or light shelf surfaces depending on if they are view or daylight windows. East and west view windows will have internal shading controls. In spaces with daylighting controls daylight sensors will be added. The modeler should inspect where the sensors were placed, the recommended illuminance setpoint, and the fraction of the zones lighting controlled by the sensor.
measures.modeler_description: This measure is intended for use in models created form space types defined in the primary and secondary building types. Other space types used in the model will not receive any new fenestration, however fenestration will be removed from all space types. Attic and plenum spaces will not receive any new fenestration. Daylighting will only be added to north and south facades. North and south facades can be +/- 30 degrees of north and south. East and west facades will only receive view windows. Mechanical rooms won't relieve any view or daylight windows. Kitchens and Restrooms wont' receive any view windows. Toplighting will not be added. In sidelit spaces the sensor's depth in from the wall will typically be the same as the height of the wall that the daylight windows is on. This depth is also what is used to calculate the daylight fraction of the space. In spaces that are non convex, such as an L shaped space, we may not be able to place a sensor, if that happens a warning will be issued.

arguments.option_2: Option 2 Description: This measure will remove all existing exterior windows, glass doors, and skylights from your model. They will be replaced with view and daylight windows as recommended by the Net Zero K12 recommendations. Windows on the south facade will have a exterior shading or light shelf surfaces depending on if they are view or daylight windows. East and west view windows will have internal shading controls. In spaces with daylighting controls daylight sensor will be added. The modeler should inspect where the sensors were placed, the recommended illuminance setpoint, and the fraction of the zones lighting controlled by the sensor.

measures.name: zedgk_12_swh
measures.description: Use 90% efficient natural gas-fired storage tank water heater. Water use demand is caluclated per student.
measures.modeler_description: Measure is applied to restroom and kitchen space types for both primary and secondary schools, and to gyms for secondary schools.  All existing swh systems are deleted.  The largest kitchen and gym spaces are selected as representative spaces, to which the corresponding ZEDG recommended swh loads are applied.  For restrooms, the total SWH load is divided evenly among the restroom spaces in the model.  Loads are applied on a per student basis.  The user can input number of students manually.  Otherwise, the measure will calculate the number of students from the classroom floor area.  If there is no classroom floor area, the user wil be required to specify a number of students.

arguments.option_1: Option 1 Description: Todo - update this to use electric. Measure replaces existing swh equipment (if any) with the swh equipment recommendations of the 50% K-12 AEDG.

options.name: ZEDG SWH Primary
options.description: Option 1 Description: Todo - update this to use electric. Measure replaces existing swh equipment (if any) with the swh equipment recommendations of the 50% K-12 AEDG.

measures.name: zedgk_12_kitchen
measures.description: Electric equipment added per ZEDG recommendations for kitchens. Refrigeration is included in the plug loads.
measures.modeler_description: Measure is only applied to kitchen space types.  All refrigeration systems are deleted (assumption is that refrigeration would only be needed for kitchen operations).  Gas and electric equipment are removed from kitchen spaces.  The largest kitchen space is selected as the representative space, to which ZEDG recommended kitchen loads are applied.  Loads are applied on a per student basis.  The user can input number of students manually.  Otherwise, the measure will calculate the number of students from the classroom floor area.  If there is no classroom floor area, the user wil be required to specify a number of students.

arguments.option_1: Option 1 Description: Todo - update this to use electric. Measure replaces existing kitchen equipment (if any) with refrigeration, electric, and gas equipment that align with the kitchen equipment recommendations of the 50% K-12 AEDG.

options.name: ZEDG Kitchen Primary
options.description: Option 1 Description: Todo - update this to use electric. Measure replaces existing kitchen equipment (if any) with refrigeration, electric, and gas equipment that align with the kitchen equipment recommendations of the 50% K-12 AEDG.

measures.name: aedg_k_12_exterior_lighting
measures.description: This measure will create exterior lights objects in four different categories described below. The lighting levels and controls will be based on the "How to Implement Recommendations" section in the AEDG; any existing exterior lighting will be removed. A special input is needed for this measure to define the exterior lighting zone, which further describes whether the site is urban or rural.
measures.modeler_description:
Provide an area or dimensions as input for each of the exterior lighting categories described below. 
- Facade and landscape lighting
- Parking lots and drives
- Walkways, plaza, and special features areas
- All other exterior lighting
    
Lighting Zones:
0 - Undeveloped areas within national parks, state parks, forest land, rural areas, and other undeveloped areas as defined by the authority having jurisdiction (no lighting recommendations)
1 - Developed areas of national parks, state parks, forest land, and rural areas (no lighting recommendations)
2 - Areas predominantly consisting of residential zoning, neighborhood business districts, light industrial with limited nighttime use and residential mixed use areas
3 - All other areas
4 - High activity commercial districts in major metropolitan areas as designated by the local jurisdiction

arguments.option_2: Option 2 Description: This measure will create exterior lights objects in four different categories described below. The lighting levels and controls will be based on the "How to Implement Recommendations" section in the AEDG; any existing exterior lighting will be removed. A special input is needed for this measure to define the exterior lighting zone, which further describes whether the site is urban or rural.

measures.modeler_description: Multiple units allows for capacity variation and simultaneous heating and cooling. Each zone in the model was served by a VRF indoor terminal unit and the DOAS. Performance curves for the outdoor terminal unit entered into the model with a resistive defrost and heat recovery. Kitchen, gym and the cafeteria were served by their own outdoor units.

measures.name: zedgk_12_hvac
measures.display_name: ZEDG K12 HVAC GSHP with DOAS
measures.description: Each zone served by the DOAS (classrooms, corridors, library/media center, lobbies, mechanical rooms, offices, and restrooms) was modeled with a two-speed GSHP.
measures.modeler_description: The heat pumps rejected energy to a single plant loop that was served by a 90% efficient variable-speed pump with 40 ft of head and a design loop exit temperature set point of 69.8F. A ground heat exchanger was modeled using the EnergyPlus Runtime Language. The EnergyPlus Runtime Language program raised the temperature of the loop 10F if the entering water temperature was lower than 60F, and it lowered the temperature of the loop 10F if the entering water temperature was higher than 60F.

arguments.option_1: Option 1 Description: Each zone served by the DOAS (classrooms, corridors, library/media center, lobbies, mechanical rooms, offices, and restrooms) was modeled with a two-speed GSHP.

measures.name: zedg_k_12_hvac_fan_coil_doas_air_cooled_chiller
measures.display_name: ZEDG K12 HVAC Fan Coil DOAS Air Cooled Chiller
measures.description: Measure replaces existing HVAC system (if any) with a Fan Coil with DOAS HVAC with air cooled Chiller system (one DOAS per floor).
measures.modeler_description: The fan coil with DOAS system (centralized DOAS, with zone level conditioning) is applied to all space types except Cafeteria, Kitchen, Gym, and Auditorium; packaged single zone equipment is applied to those zones.  In select cases, the user is given the option to preserve existing HVAC schedules.  In other cases, new schedules are generated that align with ZEDG recommendations. Air handler with chiller, gas-fired boiler and DOAS is a widely used HVAC system in schools and was thus included in the analysis. An air-cooled chiller was preferred over a water-cooled chiller by the project committee. The main reason being the later has maintenance issues which school districts want to avoid due to shortage of funds and personnel.

measures.name: openstudio_results
measures.description: This measure creates high level tables and charts pulling both from model inputs and EnergyPlus results. It has building level information as well as detail on space types, thermal zones, HVAC systems, envelope characteristics, and economics. Click the heading above a chart to view a table of the chart data.
measures.modeler_description: For the most part consumption data comes from the tabular EnergyPlus results, however there are a few requests added for time series results. Space type and loop details come from the OpenStudio model. The code for this is modular, making it easy to use as a template for your own custom reports. The structure of the report uses bootstrap, and the graphs use dimple js.

measures.name: envelope_and_internal_load_breakdown
measures.description: Report provides annual and monthly views into heat gains and losses for envelope and internal loads.
measures.modeler_description: It uses the following variables: Electric Equipment Total Heating Energy, Zone Lights Total Heating Energy, Zone, People Sensible Heating Energy, Surface Average Face Conduction Heat Transfer Energy, Surface Window Heat Gain Energy, Surface Window Heat Loss Energy, Zone Infiltration Sensible Heat Gain Energy, Zone Infiltration Sensible Heat Loss Energy. For Surface Average Face Conduction Heat Transfer Energy bin positive values as heat gain and negative values as heat loss.

da_descriptions.name: Aurora CO
da_descriptions.description: Option 12 Description: Change the building location

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG Elec Equip
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description: Customized values for ZEDG - This measure removes all existing electric equipment from spaces recognized as primary or secondary school space types. One exception is that loads assigned directly to a space whre the load definition contains "Elev" or "elev" will be left alone. New electric equipment will be added based on the 50% K12 AEDG recommendations. Kitchen equipment wont' be altered by this measure. There is a stand alone AEDG measure specifically for the kitchen.

da_descriptions.name: AEDG Elec Equip Controls
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG Int Lighting
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description

da_descriptions.name: AEDG Int Lighting Controls
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG Ext Wall
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description: ZEDG version, currently only set for steel frame walls. This measure will modify existing exterior wall insulation levels based on construction type and climate zone. The exterior wall construction type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. For mass and metal walls if an existing insulation layer can be found it will be increased, if not a new insulation layer will be added. For mass this will be at the exterior of the construction. For metal it will be added just behind the exterior layer. For steel and wood framed walls, insulation will be added to the exterior of the construction.

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG Roof
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description: ZEDG version, only setup for IEAD roof. This measure will modify existing roof insulation levels and Solar Reflective Index (SRI) values based on roof type and climate zone. The roof type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. If your model uses an attic, all attic surfaces should have an "Attic' intended surface type. For attics it doesn't matter what you put for "Standards Construction Type". The measure will check attic insulation where the attic is adjacent to other not attic spaces.

da_descriptions.name: AEDG Int Finishes
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG Fenistration with Daylighting
da_descriptions.description: Option 2 Description: This measure will remove all existing exterior windows, glass doors, and skylights from your model. They will be replaced with view and daylight windows as recommended by the Net Zero K12 recommendations. Windows on the south facade will have a exterior shading or light shelf surfaces depending on if they are view or daylight windows. East and west view windows will have internal shading controls. In spaces with daylighting controls daylight sensor will be added. The modeler should inspect where the sensors were placed, the recommended illuminance setpoint, and the fraction of the zones lighting controlled by the sensor.

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG Envelope Infiltration

steps.description: Option 1 Description: ZEDG version, currently only set for steel frame walls. This measure will modify existing exterior wall insulation levels based on construction type and climate zone. The exterior wall construction type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. For mass and metal walls if an existing insulation layer can be found it will be increased, if not a new insulation layer will be added. For mass this will be at the exterior of the construction. For metal it will be added just behind the exterior layer. For steel and wood framed walls, insulation will be added to the exterior of the construction.
steps.name: ZEDG Ext Wall

steps.description: Option 1 Description: ZEDG version, only setup for IEAD roof. This measure will modify existing roof insulation levels and Solar Reflective Index (SRI) values based on roof type and climate zone. The roof type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. If your model uses an attic, all attic surfaces should have an "Attic' intended surface type. For attics it doesn't matter what you put for "Standards Construction Type". The measure will check attic insulation where the attic is adjacent to other not attic spaces.

steps.description: Option 2 Description: This measure will remove all existing exterior windows, glass doors, and skylights from your model. They will be replaced with view and daylight windows as recommended by the Net Zero K12 recommendations. Windows on the south facade will have a exterior shading or light shelf surfaces depending on if they are view or daylight windows. East and west view windows will have internal shading controls. In spaces with daylighting controls daylight sensor will be added. The modeler should inspect where the sensors were placed, the recommended illuminance setpoint, and the fraction of the zones lighting controlled by the sensor.

datapoints.name: HVAC GSHP

da_descriptions.name: Aurora CO
da_descriptions.description: Option 12 Description: Change the building location

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG Elec Equip
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description: Customized values for ZEDG - This measure removes all existing electric equipment from spaces recognized as primary or secondary school space types. One exception is that loads assigned directly to a space whre the load definition contains "Elev" or "elev" will be left alone. New electric equipment will be added based on the 50% K12 AEDG recommendations. Kitchen equipment wont' be altered by this measure. There is a stand alone AEDG measure specifically for the kitchen.

da_descriptions.name: AEDG Elec Equip Controls
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG Int Lighting
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description

da_descriptions.name: AEDG Int Lighting Controls
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG Ext Wall
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description: ZEDG version, currently only set for steel frame walls. This measure will modify existing exterior wall insulation levels based on construction type and climate zone. The exterior wall construction type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. For mass and metal walls if an existing insulation layer can be found it will be increased, if not a new insulation layer will be added. For mass this will be at the exterior of the construction. For metal it will be added just behind the exterior layer. For steel and wood framed walls, insulation will be added to the exterior of the construction.

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG Roof
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description: ZEDG version, only setup for IEAD roof. This measure will modify existing roof insulation levels and Solar Reflective Index (SRI) values based on roof type and climate zone. The roof type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. If your model uses an attic, all attic surfaces should have an "Attic' intended surface type. For attics it doesn't matter what you put for "Standards Construction Type". The measure will check attic insulation where the attic is adjacent to other not attic spaces.

da_descriptions.name: AEDG Int Finishes
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG Fenistration with Daylighting
da_descriptions.description: Option 2 Description: This measure will remove all existing exterior windows, glass doors, and skylights from your model. They will be replaced with view and daylight windows as recommended by the Net Zero K12 recommendations. Windows on the south facade will have a exterior shading or light shelf surfaces depending on if they are view or daylight windows. East and west view windows will have internal shading controls. In spaces with daylighting controls daylight sensor will be added. The modeler should inspect where the sensors were placed, the recommended illuminance setpoint, and the fraction of the zones lighting controlled by the sensor.

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG Envelope Infiltration
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG SWH Primary
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description: Todo - update this to use electric. Measure replaces existing swh equipment (if any) with the swh equipment recommendations of the 50% K-12 AEDG.

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG Kitchen Primary
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description: Todo - update this to use electric. Measure replaces existing kitchen equipment (if any) with refrigeration, electric, and gas equipment that align with the kitchen equipment recommendations of the 50% K-12 AEDG.

da_descriptions.name: AEDG Ext Lighting Primary
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description

da_descriptions.name: Elevators
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description: This measure allows you to create new electric equipment instance and assign it directly to a space in the model. It requires that the schedule and electric equipment definition already exist in the model. Additionally it has arguments for target space and multiplier

da_descriptions.name: Electric Kiln
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description: This measure allows you to create new electric equipment instance and assign it directly to a space in the model. It requires that the schedule and electric equipment definition already exist in the model. Additionally it has arguments for target space and multiplier

da_descriptions.name: Rooftop PV 75%
da_descriptions.description: Option 2 Description: This measure will create new shading surface geometry above the roof for each thermal zone inyour model where the surface azmith falls within the user specified range. Arguments are exposed for panel efficiency, inverter efficiency, and the fraction of each roof surface that has PV

da_descriptions.name: Thermostat Typical
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description: Sets zone thermostat schedules to schedules in the same file. If a zone does not have a thermostat this measure will add one

da_descriptions.name: Thermostat Gym
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description: Sets zone thermostat schedules to schedules in the same file. If a zone does not have a thermostat this measure will add one

da_descriptions.name: zedgvrf_with_doas
da_descriptions.description: Adds VRF system with multiple indoor units connected to an outdoor unit.

da_descriptions.name: GSHP
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description: Each zone served by the DOAS (classrooms, corridors, library/media center, lobbies, mechanical rooms, offices, and restrooms) was modeled with a two-speed GSHP.

da_descriptions.name: zedg_k_12_hvac_fan_coil_doas_air_cooled_chiller
da_descriptions.description: Measure replaces existing HVAC system (if any) with a Fan Coil with DOAS HVAC with air cooled Chiller system (one DOAS per floor).

da_descriptions.name: create_baseline_building
da_descriptions.description: Creates the Performance Rating Method baseline building.  For 90.1, this is the Appendix G aka LEED Baseline.  For India ECBC, this is the Appendix D Baseline.  Note: for 90.1, this model CANNOT be used for code compliance; it is not the same as the Energy Cost Budget baseline.

da_descriptions.name: Tariff Flat
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description: This measure sets flat rates for electricity, gas, water, district heating, and district cooling.

da_descriptions.name: Results
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description

da_descriptions.name: Envelope and Internal Load Breakdown
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description: Report provides annual and monthly views into heat gains and losses for envelope and internal loads.

steps.description: Option 1 Description: ZEDG version, currently only set for steel frame walls. This measure will modify existing exterior wall insulation levels based on construction type and climate zone. The exterior wall construction type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. For mass and metal walls if an existing insulation layer can be found it will be increased, if not a new insulation layer will be added. For mass this will be at the exterior of the construction. For metal it will be added just behind the exterior layer. For steel and wood framed walls, insulation will be added to the exterior of the construction.
steps.name: ZEDG Ext Wall

steps.description: Option 1 Description: ZEDG version, only setup for IEAD roof. This measure will modify existing roof insulation levels and Solar Reflective Index (SRI) values based on roof type and climate zone. The roof type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. If your model uses an attic, all attic surfaces should have an "Attic' intended surface type. For attics it doesn't matter what you put for "Standards Construction Type". The measure will check attic insulation where the attic is adjacent to other not attic spaces.

steps.description: Option 2 Description: This measure will remove all existing exterior windows, glass doors, and skylights from your model. They will be replaced with view and daylight windows as recommended by the Net Zero K12 recommendations. Windows on the south facade will have a exterior shading or light shelf surfaces depending on if they are view or daylight windows. East and west view windows will have internal shading controls. In spaces with daylighting controls daylight sensor will be added. The modeler should inspect where the sensors were placed, the recommended illuminance setpoint, and the fraction of the zones lighting controlled by the sensor.

da_descriptions.name: Aurora CO
da_descriptions.description: Option 12 Description: Change the building location

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG Elec Equip
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description: Customized values for ZEDG - This measure removes all existing electric equipment from spaces recognized as primary or secondary school space types. One exception is that loads assigned directly to a space whre the load definition contains "Elev" or "elev" will be left alone. New electric equipment will be added based on the 50% K12 AEDG recommendations. Kitchen equipment wont' be altered by this measure. There is a stand alone AEDG measure specifically for the kitchen.

da_descriptions.name: AEDG Elec Equip Controls
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG Int Lighting
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description

da_descriptions.name: AEDG Int Lighting Controls
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG Ext Wall
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description: ZEDG version, currently only set for steel frame walls. This measure will modify existing exterior wall insulation levels based on construction type and climate zone. The exterior wall construction type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. For mass and metal walls if an existing insulation layer can be found it will be increased, if not a new insulation layer will be added. For mass this will be at the exterior of the construction. For metal it will be added just behind the exterior layer. For steel and wood framed walls, insulation will be added to the exterior of the construction.

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG Roof
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description: ZEDG version, only setup for IEAD roof. This measure will modify existing roof insulation levels and Solar Reflective Index (SRI) values based on roof type and climate zone. The roof type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. If your model uses an attic, all attic surfaces should have an "Attic' intended surface type. For attics it doesn't matter what you put for "Standards Construction Type". The measure will check attic insulation where the attic is adjacent to other not attic spaces.

da_descriptions.name: AEDG Int Finishes
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG Fenistration with Daylighting
da_descriptions.description: Option 2 Description: This measure will remove all existing exterior windows, glass doors, and skylights from your model. They will be replaced with view and daylight windows as recommended by the Net Zero K12 recommendations. Windows on the south facade will have a exterior shading or light shelf surfaces depending on if they are view or daylight windows. East and west view windows will have internal shading controls. In spaces with daylighting controls daylight sensor will be added. The modeler should inspect where the sensors were placed, the recommended illuminance setpoint, and the fraction of the zones lighting controlled by the sensor.

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG Envelope Infiltration

da_descriptions.name: ZEDG SWH Primary

This measure will modify existing exterior wall insulation levels based on construction type and climate zone. The exterior wall construction type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. "}, {:measure_name=>"zedgk_12_roof_construction", :workflow_index=>6, :name=>"ZEDG Roof", :description=>"Option 1 Description: ZEDG version, only setup for IEAD roof. For attics it doesn't matter what you put for \"Standards Construction Type\". The exterior wall construction type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. For attics it doesn't matter what you put for \"Standards Construction Type\". This measure will modify existing exterior wall insulation levels based on construction type and climate zone. The exterior wall construction type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. For mass and metal walls if an existing insulation layer can be found it will be increased, if not a new insulation layer will be added. For mass this will be at the exterior of the construction. For metal it will be added just behind the exterior layer. For steel and wood framed walls, insulation will be added to the exterior of the construction. "}, {:measure_name=>"zedgk_12_roof_construction", :workflow_index=>6, :name=>"ZEDG Roof", :description=>"Option 1 Description: ZEDG version, only setup for IEAD roof. For attics it doesn't matter what you put for \"Standards Construction Type\". This measure will modify existing exterior wall insulation levels based on construction type and climate zone. The exterior wall construction type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. For mass and metal walls if an existing insulation layer can be found it will be increased, if not a new insulation layer will be added. For mass this will be at the exterior of the construction. For metal it will be added just behind the exterior layer. For steel and wood framed walls, insulation will be added to the exterior of the construction. "}, {:measure_name=>"zedgk_12_roof_construction", :workflow_index=>6, :name=>"ZEDG Roof", :description=>"Option 1 Description: ZEDG version, only setup for IEAD roof. For attics it doesn't matter what you put for \"Standards Construction Type\". This measure will modify existing exterior wall insulation levels based on construction type and climate zone. The exterior wall construction type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. steps.description: Option 1 Description: ZEDG version, currently only set for steel frame walls. This measure will modify existing exterior wall insulation levels based on construction type and climate zone. The exterior wall construction type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. For mass and metal walls if an existing insulation layer can be found it will be increased, if not a new insulation layer will be added. For mass this will be at the exterior of the construction. For metal it will be added just behind the exterior layer. For steel and wood framed walls, insulation will be added to the exterior of the construction.
steps.name: ZEDG Ext Wall

steps.description: Option 1 Description: ZEDG version, only setup for IEAD roof. This measure will modify existing roof insulation levels and Solar Reflective Index (SRI) values based on roof type and climate zone. The roof type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. If your model uses an attic, all attic surfaces should have an "Attic' intended surface type. For attics it doesn't matter what you put for "Standards Construction Type". The measure will check attic insulation where the attic is adjacent to other not attic spaces.

steps.description: Option 2 Description: This measure will remove all existing exterior windows, glass doors, and skylights from your model. They will be replaced with view and daylight windows as recommended by the Net Zero K12 recommendations. Windows on the south facade will have a exterior shading or light shelf surfaces depending on if they are view or daylight windows. East and west view windows will have internal shading controls. In spaces with daylighting controls daylight sensor will be added. The modeler should inspect where the sensors were placed, the recommended illuminance setpoint, and the fraction of the zones lighting controlled by the sensor.
steps.name: ZEDG Fenistration with Daylighting

da_descriptions.name: Aurora CO
da_descriptions.description: Option 12 Description: Change the building location

da_descriptions.name: zedgk_12_electric_equipment
da_descriptions.description: This measure removes all existing electric equipment from spaces recognized as primary or secondary school space types. One exception is that loads assigned directly to a space where the load definition contains "Elev" or "elev" will be left alone. New electric equipment will be added based on the K12 ZEDG recommendations. Kitchen equipment won't be altered by this measure. There is a stand alone ZEDG measure specifically for the kitchen.

da_descriptions.name: aedg_k_12_electric_equipment_controls
da_descriptions.description: This measure reduces the values associated with electric equipment schedules to simulate reductions due to equipment controls throughout the building. This includes occupancy based outlets or adapters, as well as network or timer based controls. Kitchen equipment controls are not altered by this measure. The kitchen has a dedicated measure of its own which includes equipment controls.

da_descriptions.name: zedgk_12_interior_lighting
da_descriptions.description: This measure removes all existing electric equipment objects from spaces recognized as primary or secondary school space types, with the exception of the kitchen which has a dedicated measure that should be used. New equipment will be added based on the Net Zero K12 recommendations.

da_descriptions.name: aedg_k_12_interior_lighting_controls
da_descriptions.description: This measure reduces the values associated with lighting schedules to simulate reductions due to vacancy sensors throughout the building.

da_descriptions.name: zedgk_12_exterior_wall_construction
da_descriptions.description: This measure will modify existing exterior wall insulation levels based on construction type and climate zone. The climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. For steel and wood framed walls, insulation will be added to the exterior of the construction.

da_descriptions.name: zedgk_12_roof_construction
da_descriptions.description: ZEDG version, only setup for IEAD roof. This measure will modify existing roof insulation levels and Solar Reflective Index (SRI) values based on roof type and climate zone. The roof type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. If your model uses an attic, all attic surfaces should have an "Attic' intended surface type. For attics it doesn't matter what you put for "Standards Construction Type". The measure will check attic insulation where the attic is adjacent to other not attic spaces.

da_descriptions.name: aedg_k_12_interior_finishes
da_descriptions.description: This measure will adjust the visible reflectance of materials used on interior building surfaces. Different target values will be set for floors, ceilings, and furniture/interior partition surfaces.

da_descriptions.name: zedgk_12_fenestration_and_daylighting_controls
da_descriptions.description: This measure will remove all existing exterior windows, glass doors, and skylights from your model. They will be replaced with view and daylight windows as recommended by the Net Zero K12 recommendations. Windows on the south facade will have a exterior shading or light shelf surfaces depending on if they are view or daylight windows. East and west view windows will have internal shading controls. In spaces with daylighting controls daylight sensors will be added. The modeler should inspect where the sensors were placed, the recommended illuminance setpoint, and the fraction of the zones lighting controlled by the sensor.

da_descriptions.name: zedgk_12_envelope_infiltration
da_descriptions.description: This measure addresses total building infiltration values.

da_descriptions.name: zedgk_12_swh
da_descriptions.description: Use 90% efficient natural gas-fired storage tank water heater. Water use demand is caluclated per student.

da_descriptions.name: zedgk_12_kitchen
da_descriptions.description: Electric equipment added per ZEDG recommendations for kitchens. Refrigeration is included in the plug loads.

da_descriptions.name: AEDG Ext Lighting Baseline
da_descriptions.description: Option 2 Description: This measure will create exterior lights objects in four different categories described below. The lighting levels and controls will be based on the "How to Implement Recommendations" section in the AEDG; any existing exterior lighting will be removed. A special input is needed for this measure to define the exterior lighting zone, which further describes whether the site is urban or rural.

da_descriptions.name: Elevators
da_descriptions.description: Option 1 Description: This measure allows you to create new electric equipment instance and assign it directly to a space in the model. It requires that the schedule and electric equipment definition already exist in the model. Additionally it has arguments for target space and multiplier
